availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Shelby County, Kentucky, soldier. Pennsylvania native. Son of J. C. Petry and Elizabeth Petry. Resident of Shelby County in 1860. Served in the 15th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a drummer, private, and sergeant major from December 14, 1861 to January 14, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Shelby County, District 1, p. 246.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 894-895.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 285.
Find A Grave, "George Petry (1843-1889)," Memorial #144571148, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/144571148 (accessed March 5, 2020).
